gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module performs soft calibration for a memory controller block (MCB). It handles both input termination calibration and dynamic DQS calibration. The module goes through various states to set termination values, adjust DQS delays, and optimize signal integrity. It interfaces with IODRP (IO DRP) controllers to configure I/O settings and interacts with the MCB to apply calibration results. The calibration process includes steps like setting P-term and N-term values, adjusting DQS delays, and analyzing max values to achieve optimal signal quality for memory operations.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
UI_CLK, RST, PLL_LOCK, SELFREFRESH_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE, RZQ_IN, RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IN, ZIO_IODRP_SDO, MCB_UOSDO, MCB_UODONECAL, MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG, MCB_UODATA, MCB_UODATAVALID, MCB_UOCMDREADY, MCB_UO_CAL_START.

Explanation:
UI_CLK: User interface clock input.
RST: Reset signal input.
PLL_LOCK: PLL lock signal input.
SELFREFRESH_REQ: Self-refresh request input.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE: Self-refresh MCB mode input.
RZQ_IN, ZIO_IN: Reference impedance inputs.
RZQ_IODRP_SDO, ZIO_IODRP_SDO: IODRP serial data outputs for RZQ and ZIO.
MCB_UOSDO: MCB user output serial data.
MCB_UODONECAL: MCB user output done calibration signal.
MCB_UOREFRSHFLAG: MCB user output refresh flag.
MCB_UODATA: MCB user output data.
MCB_UODATAVALID: MCB user output data valid signal.
MCB_UOCMDREADY: MCB user output command ready signal.
MCB_UO_CAL_START: MCB user output calibration start signal.

Output ports:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL, SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE, IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI, RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS, MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL, MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC, MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIREAD, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC, MCB_RECAL, MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT, MCB_SYSRST, Max_Value, CKE_Train.

Explanation:
DONE_SOFTANDHARD_CAL: Indicates completion of soft and hard calibration.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_REQ, SELFREFRESH_MODE: Self-refresh control signals.
IODRP_ADD, IODRP_SDI: IODRP address and serial data input signals.
RZQ_IODRP_CS, ZIO_IODRP_CS: IODRP chip select signals for RZQ and ZIO.
MCB_UIADD, MCB_UISDI, MCB_UICS, MCB_UIDRPUPDATE, MCB_UIBROADCAST, MCB_UIADDR, MCB_UICMDEN, MCB_UIDONECAL: MCB user input control signals.
MCB_UIDQLOWERDEC, MCB_UIDQLOWERINC, MCB_UIDQUPPERDEC, MCB_UIDQUPPERINC: DQ calibration control signals.
MCB_UILDQSDEC, MCB_UILDQSINC, MCB_UIUDQSDEC, MCB_UIUDQSINC: LDQS and UDQS calibration control signals.
MCB_UIREAD: MCB user input read signal.
MCB_RECAL: MCB recalibration signal.
MCB_UICMD, MCB_UICMDIN, MCB_UIDQCOUNT: MCB user input command signals.
MCB_SYSRST: MCB system reset signal.
Max_Value: Maximum calibration value output.
CKE_Train: CKE training signal output.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Internal signals:
STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done, PLL_LOCK_R1, PLL_LOCK_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R1, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R3, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R1, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R2, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R3, WAIT_SELFREFRESH_EXIT_DQS_CAL, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH, START_DYN_CAL_STATE_R1, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH_R1, Rst_condition1, WAIT_200us_COUNTER, WaitTimer, WarmEnough.

Explanation:
STATE: Represents the current state of the calibration state machine.
P_Term, N_Term: Store P-term and N-term values for termination calibration.
P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w: Skewed P-term and N-term values for specific calibration steps.
P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev: Previous P-term and N-term values for comparison.
IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA: Address and data for IODRP controller operations.
Active_IODRP: Indicates which IODRP (RZQ, ZIO, or MCB_PORT) is currently active.
IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST: Control signals for IODRP controller.
MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST: Control signals for MCB operations.
Pre_SYSRST: Internal reset signal for MCB system reset.
IODRP_SDO: Serial data output for IODRP operations.
Max_Value_Previous: Stores the previous maximum calibration value.
count, counter_en: Counter and enable signal for timing operations.
First_Dyn_Cal_Done: Flag indicating completion of first dynamic calibration.
DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY: DQS delay values for calibration.
counter_inc, counter_dec: Counters for increment and decrement operations.
RST_reg: Registered reset signal.
Block_Reset: Signal to block reset during certain operations.
MCB_UODATAVALID_U: Registered MCB user output data valid signal.
LastPass_DynCal: Indicates the type of last calibration pass (IN_TERM or DYN_CAL).
First_In_Term_Done: Flag indicating completion of first input termination calibration.
PLL_LOCK_R1, PLL_LOCK_R2: Registered PLL lock signals.
SELFREFRESH_REQ_R1, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R3: Registered self-refresh request signals.
SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R1, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R2, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R3: Registered self-refresh MCB mode signals.
WAIT_SELFREFRESH_EXIT_DQS_CAL, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH: Control signals for self-refresh related calibration.
START_DYN_CAL_STATE_R1, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH_R1: Registered signals for dynamic calibration control.
Rst_condition1: Reset condition signal.
WAIT_200us_COUNTER: Counter for 200us wait period.
WaitTimer: Timer for wait operations.
WarmEnough: Signal indicating sufficient warm-up time.

content.text: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: mcb_soft_calibration

Explanation: This module performs soft calibration for a memory controller block (MCB). It handles both input termination calibration and dynamic DQS calibration. The calibration process includes steps like setting P-term and N-term values, adjusting DQS delays, and analyzing max values to achieve optimal signal quality for memory operations.

Internal signals:
STATE, P_Term, N_Term, P_Term_s, N_Term_s, P_Term_w, N_Term_w, P_Term_Prev, N_Term_Prev, IODRPCTRLR_MEMCELL_ADDR, IODRPCTRLR_WRITE_DATA, Active_IODRP, IODRPCTRLR_R_WB, IODRPCTRLR_CMD_VALID, IODRPCTRLR_USE_BKST, MCB_CMD_VALID, MCB_USE_BKST, Pre_SYSRST, IODRP_SDO, Max_Value_Previous, count, counter_en, First_Dyn_Cal_Done, DQS_DELAY_INITIAL, DQS_DELAY, TARGET_DQS_DELAY, counter_inc, counter_dec, RST_reg, Block_Reset, MCB_UODATAVALID_U, LastPass_DynCal, First_In_Term_Done, PLL_LOCK_R1, PLL_LOCK_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R1, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R2, SELFREFRESH_REQ_R3, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R1, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R2, SELFREFRESH_MCB_MODE_R3, WAIT_SELFREFRESH_EXIT_DQS_CAL, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH, START_DYN_CAL_STATE_R1, PERFORM_START_DYN_CAL_AFTER_SELFREFRESH_R1, Rst_condition1, WAIT_200us_COUNTER, WaitTimer, WarmEnough.
